metadata.title: CVE-2019-5815 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in xsltNumberFormatGetMultipleLevel prior to libxslt 1.1.33could allow attackers to potentially exploit heap corruption via craftedXML data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.29-5ubuntu0.3
python-libxslt1 - 1.1.29-5ubuntu0.3
xsltproc - 1.1.29-5ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
libxslt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.29-5ubuntu0.3').
